Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!!  I have been using this leave-in conditioner for at least 4 years now and it is hands down my absolute favorite.  I have fine thin hair that has a slight natural wave to it and I had a hard time finding a leave-in conditioner that provided good moisture without leaving my hair greasy or weighing it down.  This stuff exactly what I needed.  I divide my hair into two sections and use a small starting at the ends and work it up to about halfway.  I always let my hair air dry and this does a great job of providing moisture and also seems to add a bit of volume.  The smell is very nice, subtle and not overwhelming.  I would say a jar lasts me about half the year.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil had me a little worried when I first opened it.  It smelled good right away but I noticed the seal had been ripped and that the white cover you peel off when you open it wasn’t glued on to the top.  I’m giving it the benefit of the doubt that the heat had caused this to occur but it did make me nervous to use it at first.  Just something for them to consider improving on.The product itself is interesting.  I was imagining more of a Shea coconut butter feel to it.  It has somewhat of that texture but a little more oil feel to it when it’s applied.  On my skin, it didn’t really absorb the way typical shea butter does.  It did moisturize my skin though but it left a little bit of that oily feel that didn’t quite dry.  I guess there’s a bit of a personal preference element to this product too.  I felt that it left my skin and particularly my hands too oily feeling.  I also used a very small amount so a little goes a long way with this product.  If this is a type of product you use often this jar will last a long time.  You can easily do your arms and legs with a small dab of it.The scent reminds me of vanilla and coconut.  It’s subtle once applied to your skin.  You certainly feel well moisturized after using it.  I just wish it soaked into my skin a little more than it did.  I think the price is decent for the amount of product you get.  Like I said though it’s a little suspect that the tamper-proof seal doesn’t seem to stay glued to the top when you first get it.  That is something I would highly recommend is reworked on this product just so the consumer can feel more confident in the product being safe.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: This made my hair fee! Really dry after application.
Review: I washed my hair with my usual professional salon brand shampoo and then applied this leave in to my towel dried hair.  I allow my hair to air dry and I wonder if that could be why my hair felt like straw once it finally dried completely.  Normally a leave in conditioner will make my hair feel so soft once its fully dried, almost too soft.  But that wasn’t the case here.I pretty much avoided my roots entirely when I applied this but found that my hair just 2 days later was greasy from root to end.  Which is not the norm for me at all (I can usually get by washing my hair just once a week, twice is an indulgence).I have long, black hair that is kinda wavy, kinda straight which I color monthly (roots only bc of those pesky gray buggers!).My hair has a tendency to feel dry/frizzy when I use products that don’t suit my needs.I won’t give up on this leave-in because I have had good results with this brand in the past.  I think I just need to find the right concoction to make this work for me.  Maybe a different shampoo or actually heat styling my hair would make a diff.I have to say that when I first opened the jar I was like OMG this smells so good!  Then when I applied it to my hair, the smell brought back memories of play time and blue playdoh (not a good thing).  But the smell did not linger.  It had zero smell shortly after application which IS a good thing.  It would be a total deal breaker if my head smelled like playdoh all day long.I hope my humble opinion has helped you in some way.Thank you for reading.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have long thick wavy box-dyed hair for reference. This leave-in conditioner is really nice, but takes some figuring out. I had a lot of trial and error before I landed on the right amount for my hair. I found that applying this conditioner to my damp hair was a little too risky. It’s easy to go overboard. I don’t know why the instructions say to apply a generous amount. When I did that, things always ended badly. Rather than scoop some out of the tub, I just tap my fingers in and use what sticks to my fingers. Focusing mostly on the ends and then brushing my hair to spread it around. If I try to spread it around with my fingers, it just ends with me using too much and having oily looking hair that looks like it needs to be washed. I really found that I had the most control with this conditioner when I applied it to my dry hair. So I apply a little bit while my hair is damp, and then go in with the rest after my hair has dried. It does a nice job of smoothing out frizz and tackling dryness. One more thing that I want to note is the scent. I was a little worried about the apple cider vinegar and peppermint, but I can’t smell them at all. I mostly just smell shea butter and it’s pretty mild. This isn’t a leave-in conditioner that will overpower the senses or compete with perfume. I’m really happy with this product now that I have figured it out for my hair type, but it did take a bit of learning before I got my desired result. And at the rate I am going through it, this tub will last me a very long time. Overall, it’s a very nice leave-in conditioner…just go light!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have naturally curly hair, and it can be unmanageable at times, which is very frustrating. I recently got it cut, and the hairstylist recommended that I invest in a good leave-in conditioner, which should make my curls more manageable and cut down on the frizz. I have been a follower of Shea Moisture for years and have tried other products from them, so I figured it was worth it to give their leave in conditioner a try - and I am so glad I did!This product has a firmer consistency than some of the 'smoothie' products I have tried - I appreciate this because it's easier to put on and doesn't make as much of a mess. The jar is generously-sized, as well. I use a generous portion, but since I have shoulder length hair, it's not a ton. I work it through my hair and then let it air dry.It definitely makes a difference. My curls are more manageable and less unruly. I am much happier about the looks and definition overall. I highly recommend giving Shea Moisture products a try. The ingredients are more natural, it is very easy on my sensitive skin, and they really do work. They are worth the money!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First of all, I love the smell of this conditioner. Normally, I’m not fond of scented products, especially if they have even a hint of artificial fragrance as those trigger headaches. This conditioner, though, has a wonderful, natural scent that I like so much, I find myself opening the container just to sniff it. Trust me, that never happens. The scent is sort of vanilla, but not overly so, with just a hint of peppermint. On to the conditioner itself. The first time I used it I took the instructions to apply a generous amount too literally and ended up with far too much in my hair. It left a heavy, greasy feel; however, my hair styled well and had an incredible amount of volume. The next time I used less, still enjoyed the benefits of conditioned hair and lots of volume but without the greasy feel. I’ve learned I don’t have to use very much, even on my thick hair, so the tub is going to last a long time. I love this stuff!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This has a very strong scent that my husband and I decided was ‘waffle cones.’ It’s not bad, but it’s kind of strange to feel like I smell like that. I used a scented mousse but couldn’t smell it at all because this product dominated it.  It is a great moisturizer, though, and makes my hair feel really soft. I’ve used this company’s Curl & Style Milk and like that scent, so it’s too bad they didn’t use that. That other product is really difficult to get out of the bottle, though, so I do appreciate this tub. It is large (20 ounces) and should last awhile. It weighs my curls down a little, so I don’t think I’ll use it every time, but I can definitely feel that it’s softer, whether I braid or curl it. I can even tell when it gets wet that it’s more moisturized. I like it and recommend it, even over the better smelling style milk (I’ll just use a perfume or something).

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This makes me sad, as I am a Shea moisture fan, lover, and user.The container is very large.  The conditioner is a bit soupy , I feel to be in such a large, wide mouth container.I had very high hopes of the leave in conditioning my hair, softening, protecting.Using on damp hair, it spread well, seemed to absorb at first, and needing more .Seemed to be softening, but later when I wnet to scrunch a bit after hair dried, it wasa weird greasy yet hard feeling. Not crunchy, more like hardened grease.Looking at my ends later, they kept tangling and locking, and I could see breakage.I use oils, balms, and leave ins - but never really experienced something that starts out good ,and turns into zapping my hair.Maybe too much castor oil ??Sorry S.M.  this did not do it for me  :(

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Smooth thick consistency and a very mild scent. You get a nice size tub of it, 11 oz. Conditioner has Jamaican black castor oil in it plus peppermint, apple cider vinegar and organic Shea butter. You can smell the apple cider vinegar in it. Smells nice, very mild, not overpowering. Consistency of the conditioner is good, melts into the hair nicely. Ingredients look natural and the conditioner contains no sulfates, parabens, mineral oil, phthalates or glycol. Also no animal testing. Black castor oil has omega 3's in it, the peppermint invigorates the scalp and the Shea butter moisturizes nicely. I enjoyed using it- it feels good on, I like the result and it's all natural. You get a lot and a little goes a long way. Overall, a good conditioner.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a large jar of leave in conditioner. It’s easy to scoop out and apply to the hair. The top unscrews so every last bit can be used without wasting any like in a squeeze bottle. I leave it beside the tub so when my little girl is done with her bath I put some on her ends that tangle easily. It’s softening and absorbs well in her hair. The scent is soft and smells like vanilla to me. It’s sweet and pleasant. Even after her hair has dried, you can still smell the leave in conditioner.  I also like to run her large tooth comb through her hair with the product in to really help cover all the strands. I have been pleased with the moisture this puts back into the hair. It makes it silky smooth and smell lovely.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: When it comes to the SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Strengthen & Restore Leave-In Conditioner, 11 Fluid Ounce I really don't care for the smell.  This is more moisturizing than the other JBCO leave-in by SheaMoisture, but just barely.  I would say its just not moisturizing enough even in an optimal setting with my hair.  I could have clean hair that is misted with warm warm and my hair doesn't feel moisturized enough with just this.  I still have to use it with other conditioners and lotions.  My hair felt dry after I took my twist out down.  The twist out itself was OK, not the best, but not the worst, but my hair was just so straw like.  I wanted to wash my hair again and start over with something else.  I have 4C Low Porosity hair.  I didn't check the ingredients to see if this is actually good for low porosity, but you live and learn.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Fantastic cream for my fine, flyaway hair!
Review: This Shea Moisture leave-in conditioner is my new must-have hair product! I have baby fine, shoulder length, straight hair. I color my gray (which is probably about 75%) so I have the added problem of flyaway, quirky gray hairs that stick out at weird angles. I have been searching for a product that tames my hair without weighing it down, and I have found it!First, on opening the generously-sized jar, I noticed the delicious fragrance! The natural ingredients combine to give this an almost cookie-like scent! It’s a really nice experience to smell this every day while I style my hair.The directions say to use a “generous amount.” I took this advice and used about 1/2 ping pong ball size the first time. Oops, much too much! This made it hard to dry my hair, and made my hair feel coated and look slightly greasy. It washes out easily and entirely. So, the next morning, I tried a fingernail-size dab. Perfect!I’ve been using this leave-in conditioner daily and have reaped several benefits. It does do what I have been searching for by taming the flyaway grays to the extent that it can. My bob style stays smooth and lasts longer. Fine side hairs don’t fly in my face nearly as often. My hair looks shiny and smooth and feels really healthy. I have a small area of ends that are heat damaged, and a tiny bit extra of this cream smooths this area and makes it unnoticeable.SheaMoisture has created an amazing cream that I will be buying on repeat!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I prefer this leave-in over the lotion. This is lightweight & leaves my hair every moisturized. I could go about 2 days without having to reapply any additional product in my hair, which is what I do on weekends. I don’t seem to need as much when compared to the lotion. I apply this after washing my hair & do not need to apply any other product in my hair except gel/mousse to my edge to prevent flyaway.MoistureIt moisture my hair very well & I don’t need to add any other oil or moisturizer. It also allows me to go longer (a week) before washing my hair. I use to wash my hair everyday to every other day. My hair feels moisturized without feeling greasy or oily.ScentThe scent is lighter than the lotion which can be unbearable. However, the scent is much lighter in the leave-in conditioner which I can tolerate & even enjoy as it’s light.BuildupI do not use this on my edge as I use gel as I find it doesn’t play nice with other products. If I put this on my edge & then apply gel, my hair gets white & flaky from product buildup.OverviewGreat moisturizer with a light scent. You do not need addition products in the hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I haven't been using this product for very long, but I am so impressed with the first couple of uses. First off, it smells so, so good - like a sweet smell that's somewhere between coconut oil, cocoa butter, and vanilla (it doesn't smell very strongly though, and the smell is totally gone once it dries). My hair honestly looks shinier and healthier than it did a few days ago when I started using this. I have pretty thin, caucasian hair, and using a dab on the lower half of my hair (mostly on the ends) is the perfect amount for me. I don't put any on my scalp since I don't want it to look oily. It really seems to have made a difference for me in the few days I've been using it, and I have tried a LOT of products with this same desired effect. I really like this product so far.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Healing in progress
Review: I have to say this product has shown some great changes in my hair so n just a weeks time. I have biracial hair that it naturally curly. Well From time to time I flat iron it to get that lengthy ponytail. I try to be careful and use a setting of no more than 370 degrees. Well when I wet my hair, I noticed that I got my Shirley temple curls BUT about the last 3 inches of my ends were “Spidery”. I think I burned by accident. The rest of my hair had pretty curls but dead straight and stiff at the ends. I got this product and in a weeks time, my natural curls are coming back when I wet my hair. Only about the last inch is still in need but even that’s softer now. It truly does restore🙂

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is one of my favorite conditioners. It has good ingredients and never disappoints us.I and my daughter have type 4b hair. I put this in after washing and conditioning, then follow up with an oil to seal in the moisture. It leaves our hair soft and manageable.It has a sweet smell that's something skin to bananas, except that I usually hat e the smell of bananas so it has to be something else.... Idk.This big tub will last us a long time.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Hair loss and damage
Review: I’ve used this product for many years and never had a problem, until this purchase. It made my hair ROCK hard, tangled, and even after I stopped using it I still have severe breakage.My oldest daughter loved it and she used it. Took out all of her hair on one side of her head! Trash.Now we both have bald spots where there weren’t any before and doing deep conditioning to get our hair back to it’s normal state.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave in conditioner is fairly ok. The jar is a decent size and the scent is nice. However, It is not the best I’ve used. It doesn’t have as much slip as I would like. On a scale from 1-100, where 100 is enough slip, I’ll give this a rating of about a 69. It just seems like something is missing or the proportions are off or something. I prefer to use it along with other products to help fill in that gap. Because of that, I don’t plan to make any future purchases.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We're really liking this leave-in. We're a family of black, white and mixed and it's been working great on each of our hair types. For first use I'd suggest starting with a small amount. It's thick but very moisturizing and a little can go a long way…especially on damp hair but you can of course apply it on dry hair. We've been putting it in our daughter's hair before bed and again in the morning and it helps make the styling process much easier.Scent-  smells good, like a mild mix between shea and cocoa butter. If you've ever smelled raw shea butter it usually has a strong smoky scent-  this is much more mild and pleasant.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Smells like playdoh, gross
Review: I washed my hair and applied as directed. First thing I noticed was that it smelled like playdoh. After a 5 days it still smells like playdoh. I just bleached my hair and I was looking for a leave-in that moisturizes. Well my hair looks dull my ends are still dry looking (I know there’s no fixing that without a cut but some products can mask that) AND on top of everything I woke up one morning with the biggest knot I’ve ever had in my hair. My hair is wavy and does not usually knot. I’ve had my hair bleached for weeks now and I never had a knot like that until I used this product. I will continue to use since I did spend money on it and give it another try. But that playdoh smell might make me throw it out.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have been using this for YEARS because I need a leave-in conditioner for my thick natural hair, so I was happy to see it available in a larger size. I use this after washing and before twisting or braiding and it makes my hair so soft and easy to comb through as I detangle. It smells great and has saved my hair from tons of breakage and is a staple in my natural hair care regimen. If you have 4C hair this is definitely the leave in conditioner for you.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I've used this product in a more lotion consistency before.  This is pretty much the same only in a tub version.  To be honest, I feel like the bottle version is cleaner to apply  - rather than sticking my fingers into a tub.  But, it works very very well for my hair and I typically put it on my hair right after my shower so I shouldnt worry too much.  It helps cut down on frizz and keeps my hair soft.  It has a very mild unoffensive scent.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I absolutely love the scent of this leave-in conditioner. I am a big fan of Shea Moisture products and this one is no exception. I am mixed (black and white) and have very thick curly hair. I use this to help keep my hair conditioned and soft. My local store is almost always out of Shea Moisture products every time I go so I appreciate that I can just order it online. It's not cheap, but it does last me a while. The amount you use just depends on your hair. I have to use generous portions because  my hair is thick and long. Others may be able to use less. Overall, would recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I'm very impressed with this! I always use the same brand/scent conditioning mask and love it. So I was excited to try the leave in conditioner. I was surprised by the watery consistency. I put it on after towel drying my hair and left my hair to dry naturally. I was worried it would make my hair too straight and take out the curl, but it didn't at all. It smoothed the frizz and left really nice curls!! Love it-highly recommended!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: NOT THE SAME PRODUCT!
Review: Buyer beware! This product is NOT what it used to be. Originally, the 11oz JBOC leave in conditioner was very similar to the OG formula that used to come in the 16oz tub. My most recent batch, however, was NOTHING like the batch from 2018. The product used to be runny, but now it's borderline watery.  As a 3c/4a curly girl,my roots are often frizzy. The product that USED to make them shiny and wavy with hold only makes my hair brittle and undefined. Shea Moisture has pulled a Shea Moisture and changed the formula AGAIN. The ingredients list looks the same, but that doesn't mean anything. The ingredients can appear in the same order, but there could more or less of something. Do NOT buy. It's not the same anymore.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really like how well this softens and keeps my hair moisturized. I have kinky hair and apply it while wet after washing and conditioning my hair. When my hair dries it feels softer. I also apply it when dry and it's great for smoothing my edges when they start to get dry. I like this a lot better than using gel. It has a very nice scent and isn't greasy or heavy on the hair while providing good moisture.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Soft hair without feeling weighed down
Review: This leave-in conditioner is great for me, I have naturally curly hair and without using leave-in conditioner after washing my hair it would be impossible to brush through. This conditioner smells amazing and makes my hair so soft without weighing it down. That's usually the problem I have with any type of conditioner, they can weigh my hair down. This one thankfully doesn't do that.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a fairly thick cream leave-in conditioner that is slightly off white in color.  The scent is soft and pleasant.  There are no silicones/dimethicones/parabens/sulfates in this, so it's exactly the type of product I want for my very curly hair.  I use a very large dollop (covers the center of my palm) for my curly hair that is past my shoulders.  I add a little more to the ends after I work the first dollop through my hair with my fingers.  This leaves my hair very soft, but not sticky or greasy.  I highly recommend this for curly hair.  I like this better than the "D. C." brand name of leave-in I usually use.  This is more economical for me as well.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This reminds me of Queen Helene Cholesterol Cream.  But it is thinner and supposed to be leave in while the Queen Helene Cholesterol Cream is rinsed off.  I think it does nourish your hair but because it has a thicker cream consistency that you leave in, it does weigh your hair down.  As a result you really would not want to put too much on your hair or use it everyday.  It is good every so often for a deeper treatment.  Another this is that your hair also looks a bit greasy with it on.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a really large container of leave in conditioner.I was pleased and surprised by the size of the jar.This is a nice consistency for a leave in.It reminds me of a medium consistency conditioner.To me the smell is like marshmallows or vanilla.It has a sweet scent but it is not too sweet.I like the way it smooths my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This has made my hair super soft! While my hair is not overly damaged it is very coarse and dry in sections and coloring has definitely taken a toll over the years. This is pretty amazing. It smells very natural with a hint of peppermint - I wash and condition my hair then apply this and put a shower cap on and leave it for a few hours (while I clean etc) and sometimes overnight.After rinsing it out my hair is so much more manageable and softer!

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My hair likes this stuff fine...it’s just the smell is a bit weird. It smells a little like playdough. It’s...certainly different, but far better than some of the heavily perfumed crap that is in other products.Helps keep my hair soft, shiny, and reasonably happy.Just make sure you don’t use too much.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Wow wow wow! My hair is naturally curly, but it's also dry as a dessert and I've been trying to find a product or the combination of products to bring back the curl. I accidentally left a protein mask on too long and even my most moisturizing mask couldn't keep my hair from being crispy after I showered, but this stuff!!! I put it on as thick as I dared and hoped for the best. My hair came out feeling amazing and even had a little hint of a curl. It smells very nice, like cocoa butter with the hint of mint and herbal, the scent faded once it dried.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: works well for me but has a terrible smell
Review: This stuff works well, I use it right out of the shower when my hair is still pretty wet. I put it all over and when my hair dries my curls keep their shape and my style stays in place. I will say that my day 2 curls are wearable but they don't look great. Also, it doesn't leave my hair feeling crunchy. The smell is TERRIBLE smells like an ashtray! The smell definitely doesn't stay once my hair is dry, it fades to a subtle smell, not at all like the ashtray smell straight out of the tub.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have fine, frizzy, chemical treated and colored hair, so I'm always looking for a good deep or leave-in conditioner. First of all, this is hands-down the absolute best smelling hair product I've ever tried. It's not a chemical smell, it's a wonderful fresh natural smell. Using this as a leave-in is a bit too much for my hair type - my hair also gets greasy easily and this exacerbates that. However, it is excellent as an overnight conditioner! It makes my hair incredibly soft and manageable.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I really like Shea Moisture products I’ve been using them for a long time. This leave in conditioner is great it has a light scent and leaves my hair feeling soft and smooth. The jar is  huge so it will last a long time. I use it after every wash.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: smells so good like their other JBCO products. i usually use the hair mask but i gave this normal conditioner a try. and after just one day of using, im really happy with the results, as it made my hair feel just as good as the mask usually does.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Some leave-in conditioners weigh my hair down but not this one. It softens, moisturizes, and detangles, leaving my hair lightly scented and gorgeous. I highly recommend it. The Jamaican black caster oil makes my hair grow quickly, too. 5 stars.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I always love using SheaMoisture products.  This huge container of creamy leave in conditioner did not disappoint.  It left my hair super soft and moisturized.  It was 5 day dry natural hair and came out good as new.  It smells amazing too.  I highly recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I know these ingredients are supposed to be awesome thats why I decided to try this. They definitly do add shine and smooth out the texture of my hair. I dont smell a scent at all which is great. Seems to dry fairly quickly so my hair isnt left greasy which I also like. There is plenty here so will surely last a long time.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Love it....
Review: I love this SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Strengthen & Restore Leave-In Conditioner, I have used quite a few of these products. This line I like for my teens color treated often bleached stressed hair. Its great on "ethnic" hair and a little goes a long way. Great product for a fair price-it works as advertised.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The biggest turn off to this product is having to put my handles in the jar. This is very inconvenient. It would be awesome if came with a pump. My concern is packaging and not the product.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: This doesn't seem to give a ton of slip right away or even when rinsing out, but it does seem to still provides benefits and leave hair in better condition. Not a fave, but it does help.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Love it!
Review: My hair breaks easily and this has helped stop frizz and breakage, leaving my hair smooth soft and silky! I love this company and have several haircare products by them and all have been great. Smells nice, does the job and helps me relax from worrying about my frizzy or messy locks.Great for those with curl as well. Helps keep curls moist and happy.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Amazing product—- I love the entire product line

Title: THE ULTIMATE HOLY GRAIL LEAVE IN CONDITIONER!!!

I HIGHLY recommend this product if you want more healthier,  moisturized, and manageable hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Jamaican Black Castor Oil Leave In Conditioner for Over-Processed, damaged hair 100% Pure Jamaican Black Castor Oil to Soften and Detangle Hair 11.5 oz
Title: Happy Curlygirly!!
Review: Oh my! I love this product! Finally found something that makes my natural curly hair look and feel great! I use a detangler first with a detangling brush then apply this product with the praying hands method, then scrunch and diffuse my hair for a five minutes so I’m not walking out the door with soaking wet hair. I’ve received so many compliments on my curls since I started using it. I love it, it’s a nice light scent and your hair doesn’t dry stiff or crunchy. I’ve loved their conditioner and used the coconut one for years, but this leave in conditioner is exactly the moisture that my curls needed! Thank you SheaMoisture! Happy Curlygirly!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz

Review: I honestly do not know how I ever survived without this product! I have curly hair and this knocks the frizz out for up to two days, although I put it in every morning, just not as much the second day! I have tried to use other products! #CantEven!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: AMAZING HYDRATION PRODUCT I ALWAYS USE IT
Review: This product keeps my hair hydrated and I am black as well as my cousin who is mixed. It keeps the hair soft and manageable. At night I sleep with a satin bonnet on my head.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: GAMECHANGER!!
Review: .. I ordered this to help bring LIFE back to my dried, fried, aging caucasian hair. ..!I have dyed and bleached my hair since i was about 14 years old. .. until I was 35.In 2020, I decided to stop damaging my hair with chemicals and to let my natural color / salt and pepper , and brunette, come through.I needed hydration. I needed protein. I needed shine!! - THIS PRODUCT DOES IT ALL!!I am so happy I gave it a try! .. works vetter than the manuka honey for my hair! My hair feels hydrated, soft, and its so shiny!! .. no more dead fried dullness! This stuff is Gold for me!!The smell is like.. Vanilla pudding.. althoigh there is a faint playdough hint... I dont mind it being thats Ill be using it as I need protein and ahine added back to my hair instead of a daily treatment. ..I am truly thankful for this stuff! I feel like its gonna change my hair healing game.. if your hair is dry, brittle, lifeless, and breaking- try this!!also,, a little goes a long way!! I have shoulder length hair,, so it may last me at least a few months if I truly use it around 1 to 2 x a week.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Absolutely love!
Review: Best leave in conditioner for my locs!!! Keeps them strong and healthy , especially after styling and maintenance. Wouldn’t dare use any other product !!!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Great for curly hair
Review: I just started properly taking care of my curls so this is my first leave-in. It works great keeping my hair moisturized and healthy but the only thing I hate is the smell. It smells like cookies dunked in apple cider vinegar--a very weird combo but it is what it is

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Not great for low porosity curly hair
Review: I have low porosity very dry hair and this product left it so oily that I thought it was going to leave stains all over my clothes and bedding. I had to wash my hair the next day. It is also suuuuuuper sticky and matted my hair. Just terrible. Overall, it’s a disgusting product that I wouldn’t recommend to anyone. The only positive thing I can say about the product is that it has a nice light scent.Of course, I don’t want to throw it away since I paid for it (and also don’t want to add to my carbon footprint), so I spoke to my stylist who told me to layer my hair with the product before I get into the pool and then the product will protect my hair from the chlorine. This is the second time that I have tried a moisturizing product besides shampoo from Shea Moisture. The other product that I had tried was the coconut and hibiscus curl enhancing smoothie. That product is also way too greasy and sticky. The only products that I can use from Shea Moisture are their shampoos. Ironically, their shampoos are excellent.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Controls frizz & softens hair
Review: My biggest regret is not trying a leave in conditioner sooner! Of course I’ve tried everything else & after watching a video on the top 5 best leave ins (this product being one of them) I decided why not give it a try? I’ve tried everything else? After one use I notice a difference in that the frizz & dryness I’ve been experiencing for years was much better & my hair was softer & more manageable when blow drying & styling. I’m going to keep using this & hopefully it’ll keep doing it’s thing!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: One of my Favorite Leave-Ins
Review: Loved this product. The scent is hit or miss with a lot of folks but I like the smell of Jamaican Black Castor. It also smells sweet but I can’t figure out if it’s a vanilla pudding scent or something else. The texture for this product is thick and a little goes a long way because it can be heavy if you are heavy handed with products. For my hair, it is best applied on wet or damp hair to get the best benefits on my 4A hair. The product is super moisturizing and the smell will linger in your hair for many days. Those who are transitioning will see the benefits because it will be a little strengthening to those tresses and will give your hair the shine and body to make it look vibrant and less damaged.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Excellent leave in conditioner!!
Review: Leaves my hair moisturized and soft. Smells amazing and I definitely got the value for my bucks. I use this along with Bella Curls curling creme. It is amazing!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Go to leave in for wavy hair
Review: I am mixed white and latino/indigenous and have had wavy hair all my life. At its healthiest my hair is a solid 2C. My hair isnt super thin but it is easily weighed down, and products made for thicker and coarser hair don't usually work for me. I'm going back to this leave in after a few stints in trying other leave ins because it just works so well. My waves become healthier and tighter, and it feels like they actually soak up this product, when other leave ins seem to create a film on my hair without effecting how moisturized it is. I have dry, damaged hair and live at a high elevation and this helps keep my hair healthy and moisturized!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Buy from the store
Review: Have used this product many times before from the store so I thought no big deal when I brought here. however, this batch smells just like clay, burned my scalp a little bit and is very watery. Not moisturizing at all! Did the process for return and they require you to return product. Please be careful because you do not know what people are doing to these products before returning. It's very easy to buy the reseal top and send to someone else.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: It does wonders for my coarse, wavy hair
Review: When I comb it through properly, it makes my whole head of hair shiny and soft. My hair can get extremely frizzy and dry at times even with other leave in conditioners and smoothing serum, I have been very impressed by this one! It really calms down the frizziness and never looks greasy, even after reapplying it the next day. I'm not wild with joy about the smell, but it is not offensive at all and being that it's a natural product the smell goes away in around 10-15 minutes. My roommate really loves the smell, so please take my opinion with a grain of salt! I have already ordered a second container of this, by the way!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Must have for curls `
Review: My hair is super curly (think 80's spiral curls) and quite stubborn.  It tends to be on the dry side and I have to use a LOT of product to keep frizz away.  I started using this about a month ago and when I got my hair colored yesterday, my cosmetologist was shocked at how silky and healthy my hair is.  Even when I don't dry my hair all the time, I still have dry ends.  I usually need weighted products to keep the volume of my hair under control but this just gives me beautiful curls.  This product combined with this hair dryer https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086LB62WK/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o04_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1  has completely changed my morning routine and saves me a LOT of time getting ready.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: This product is great for dry, tangled hair.
Review: This is my first purchase of this leave in conditioner. This product really does moisturize my very dry medium thickness hair without making it greasy. It also is a great detangler. It leaves my hair soft and gives it a nice sheen. It also helps tame frizz. I am trying to grow my hair very long. I really believe that this conditioner is going to really help with preventing breakage. A little goes a long way. I concentrate the product from the middle of my hair length downwards, and put a smaller amount above that. The smell could be better, but it is not as bad as some people are saying. It eventually fades to what I would maybe call a musky vanilla.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS
Review: THIS IS THE HOLY GRAIL, LADIES!!!!! I have incredibly dry, frizzy kinky  hair.  This product gives me uber moisture and GLOSSSSSSSS. A little goes a lonngggg way!!!!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Try This...
Review: I have thick naturally wavy hair.  Although after having 3 kids I have lost the thickness somewhat out of my hair because I have lost a lot due to birthing and breastfeeding. This product has helped with the overall restoration of how my hair “used to be before having children.”  The value is awesome because you get a lot for your money as a little bit will go a long way.  The scent smells amazing also. It is a light vanilla like smell but not like whoa overwhelming.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Breaks hair off
Review: Made my hair and grandson hair fall out, look just like we cut our hair in patches. This use to be a great product. I have a good mind to SUE!

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Love it!
Review: I finally found something that leaves my hands and hair soft - without silicones! My hair is naturally grey but i color it, leaving it frizzy, dry, and out of control. All the condioners I was using, left my hair just as dry, and made the skin on my hands very dry. This leaves my hair and hands so soft. I let my hair air dry. My grand daughter was stroking my hair and said "Mimere, your hair is so soft. It used to be so rough". I recommend it to my sister and my friends

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: Shea Moisture Jamaican Black Castor Oul
Review: Shea is a leave-in moisturizer that has saved my over processed, brittle hair.  In addition to damage from chemicals, my hair is naturally wavy & frizzy.  My hair is now stronger, healthier, & shinier as a result of using Shea.  I have been using this product for at least two years.  I highly recommend it for anyone who has dry, damaged,  brittle, frizzy hair or just wants healthy, shiny, manageable hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: I use this product differently
Review: As a leave-in, this product is too heavy for my 2c fine curls, but it works GREAT as a deep conditioner. I use it after shampoo and conditioner, leave it in for a few minutes, wash it out, and my hair is moisturized for days! If you feel it's too heavy for your hair, try it this way and see what you think. I also hate the smell so washing it out is good for that too :)

Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
Title: So far so good
Review: Cant say much just received

Unfortunately, now the formula has changed so it’s much thicker and lighter in color and it has more of a cream consistency. Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz

Title: Irritating to Skin
Review: Worked well to moisturize my hair, but the skin on my neck that touched my hair was super dry, red, and irritated after using it just once. I saw a review that said one ingredient in this, Behentrimonium Chloride, is toxic above 0.1%. I'm thinking this is why I had such a bad reaction. Product: SheaMoisture Leave In Conditioner Conditioner For Hair Jamaican Black Castor Oil To Soften and Detangle Hair 20 oz
